title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Design for Evaluating Online Library Research Guides

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in Utilizing Library Information Resources, Foundational Knowledge of Research Methodologies
context.additional_context: Customized training for current practitioners to improve work efficiency

learning_goals: Learners can analyze research guides by applying the three elements of cognitive load theory (intrinsic, extraneous, germane load).
Learners can evaluate interface elements of research guides provided in mobile environments based on cognitive usability criteria.
Learners can write three actionable proposals for improving research guides based on assessment results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
